title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
hello,

Flux traces in the u5000 and u9800 region
same 5v on all dc inputs


I removed the D6902 and read 5 volts on pin 1 again.
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR = 5 volt

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
VDDA pin shows 100ohm with gnd. When I check the same pin on another board, 500ohm appears. Could the u7000 be faulty?

I replaced the U7000. It draws 5v 0.029a right now

(R6923) PP3V3_G3H= 3.4 volt

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
Post U7000 basic voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, EN_VR1, SMC_RST*, AUX_OK, A/BMON.
Check diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H and all big coils.
SMC_USBC_INT_L goes high?

Test with known good battery (charged).
Also be sure to use 87W charger.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
P_IN = 5.1 Volt
AUX_DET = 1.2 Volt
VDDA = 5Volt
VDDAp = 5 Volt
EN_VR1 (R6921) = 5 Volt
SMC_RST = 3.4 Volt
AUX_OK (Q5490 pin2) = 3.4 Volt
(D4)AMON CHGR_AMON = 3.4 Volt
BMON CHGR_BMON = No Voltage

R3038 SMC_USBC_INT_L = No Voltage

big coils are not short circuited

diode mode  PPBUS_G3H = 0.406

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
"CHGR_AMON = 3.4 Volt"
Check R7021/22 and their traces.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
Soryy
CHGR_AMON = No Voltage R5439
CHGR_BMON = No Voltage R5429


No problem with R7021/22 resistors  and R7021/22 = 5 volt

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
I told you to check these resistors based on your bad reading.
No need to check them in fact.
Please, post accurate information in the future...

One of CD3215 may be bad, or SMC has internal damage.
Be sure first that R3038 is good.
SMC_USBC_INT_L must stay high.

"Test with known good battery (charged).
Also be sure to use 87W charger."
???

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
I checked again this morning and saw 20 volts instead of 5 volts on the keweısı. But the amperage drawn is 0 when I first plug it in, it draws 0.17a and then it drops to zero.

No original charger. I tried it with its own battery, it didn't charge. The charger I am using now creates all voltages on the same model motherboard.

SMC_USBC_INT_L  = No voltage
R3038 good

PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR : 19v

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message: SMC_BC_ACOK : 3.4 Volt

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message: 20v when I plug it into the j3300 side and 5 0.29a volts when I plug it into the jb500 side

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
Then you have problems on USB_C area of JB500.
Compare diode mode readings on CD3215 LDOs between both sides.
I also recommend to check on all JB500 lines.

BTW, get original set of 87-96-140W chargers for repair processes.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
I checked the LDOs lines, no shorts
I checked all the parts near the ub300/400 with gnd there is no short circuit
How can I narrow the field?

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
Not only short is bad.
You must compare the readings with good channel.
Also check if all LDOs come on on that area.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO / CB308 = 3,4 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA / = 1,7 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD = 1,8 Volt
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC = 1,1 Volt

1PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO = 3,4 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA = 1,8 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD = 1,8 Volt
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC = 1,1 Volt

what else do i have to check

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
You can try to reflash UB090.
Don't forget to make a backup first.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message: Can we say that the ub300/400 is solid because the above voltages are?

message: 5 volt çevriminin UB090 ile bir ilgisi var mı? Başka karttan değiştirdim yine aynı

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message: by the way, there is no PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC voltage on UB300/400

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message: what will I do :)

message: Write in english for example...

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
I'm sorry it stayed like that while translating :)

I installed UB090 from the same board and it stays at the same 5volts.
Can we say that the ub300/400 is solid because the above voltages are?

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message: Compare diode mode readings between J3300 and JB500 pins.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
Does having these voltages mean that the ub300/400 is working or  isn't ? So even if I have these voltages, is there a possibility that it is still faulty?

PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO / CB308 = 3,4 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA / = 1,7 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD = 1,8 Volt
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC = 1,1 Volt

1PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO = 3,4 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA = 1,8 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD = 1,8 Volt
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC = 1,1 Volt

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
You may have a problem on the data lines of JB500.
Even if UB300/400 are both good, can't work properly if some input is not good.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
I tried with a full battery, it won't turn on.
I replaced UB300/400, same result.
When the battery is not plugged in, the jb500 side gets 5 volts. But when the battery is inserted, it turns to 19 volts. The device does not charge and does not turn on.
It's 19v when the battery is plugged in. When the battery is not plugged in, it is 5v.

title: 820-00281-A A1707
message:
You must get same behavior on all USB-C ports.
You still have problems on USB-C areas, if can't switch to 20V without battery.
